message.content:
After working through every posting one‐by‐one and “tracking” the changes to the cash (i.e. counting only transactions that settle in cash – including receipts and payments, using bank transfers (which are “cash‐equivalents” alike) but omitting unpaid items or noncash “fixed‐asset” journal items), we get a final cash balance of approximately 7,641,650 whereas the beginning “cash and cash equivalents” (the sum of the initial “Cash deposit” plus “Bank deposit”) was 8,000,000. In net the cash (and equivalents) have decreased by about 358,350.

Thus, in the final cash flow statement the “net increase in cash and cash equivalents” is –358350.09.

Below is the answer in the requested JSON format.

--------------------------------------------------

{"solution": {"Net Increase": "-358350.09"}}
